page_content:
## Budget Planning Guide  
### Ultra Budget (Under $700/month)
**Possible Areas:**
- Woodlands / Yishun (North)
- Jurong West (Far West)
- Pasir Ris (Far East)  
**Type:**
- HDB common room
- May need to share room
- Usually older flats

### Budget ($700-1,000/month)
**Possible Areas:**
- Clementi / Buona Vista (West)
- Jurong East (West)
- Tampines / Bedok (East)
- Ang Mo Kio / Bishan (North-Central)  
**Type:**
- HDB common room
- Some Condo common rooms in far areas
- Good accessibility

### Mid-Range ($1,000-1,500/month)
**Possible Areas:**
- Clementi / Dover (Condo common rooms)
- Buona Vista / Commonwealth
- Novena / Toa Payoh
- Most central areas (HDB master rooms)  
**Type:**
- HDB master rooms in good locations
- Condo common rooms near universities
- Better facilities

### Premium ($1,500+/month)
**Possible Areas:**
- City center (Bugis, Lavender)
- Near Orchard
- Condo master rooms anywhere  
**Type:**
- Condo master rooms
- Luxury facilities
- Best locations

## Money-Saving Tips  
### Reduce Rental Costs  
1. **Location Trade-offs:**
- Live 1-2 MRT stops further: Save $100-200/month
- Accept longer commute: Save $200-300/month  
2. **Housing Type:**
- Choose HDB over Condo: Save $300-500/month
- Choose common room over master: Save $200-400/month  
3. **Timing:**
- Avoid peak seasons (July-August): Save 10-15%
- Look for mid-year vacancies: Better deals  
4. **Negotiation:**
- Ask for rent discount for 1-year lease
- Negotiate if willing to move in immediately
- Request inclusion of utilities

### Additional Cost Savings  
**Utilities:**
- Use AC sparingly: Save $30-50/month
- Energy-efficient habits
- Monitor usage with apps  
**Transport:**
- Live near MRT: Save on grab/taxi
- Student concession pass: 42% discount
- Walk when possible  
**Food:**
- Cook vs eat out: Save $300-500/month
- Hawker centers vs restaurants
- Share groceries with housemates

## Seasonal Price Trends  
### Peak Season (June-August)
- Start of academic year
- Prices increase 10-20%
- High competition
- Limited availability

### Low Season (November-January)
- Between semesters
- Better negotiation power
- More available units
- Landlords more flexible

### Shoulder Season (March-May, September-October)
- Moderate competition
- Fair pricing
- Good availability
- Best time for negotiation

## Hidden Costs to Consider  
### One-Time Costs
- Security deposit: 1-2 months
- First month rent: 1 month
- Agent fee: 0.5 months (if applicable)
- Moving costs: $50-200
- Initial furniture/household items: $200-500  
**Total Initial Cost: 2.5-4 months of rent**

### Monthly Costs Beyond Rent
- Utilities: $50-100
- Internet: $20-40 (if split)
- Household supplies: $20-40
- Maintenance (if applicable): Usually included  
**Total Monthly Beyond Rent: $90-180**

## Final Recommendations by Budget  
### $600-800 Budget
**Best Value Areas:**
1. Jurong East (near NTU)
2. Woodlands (budget priority)
3. Tampines (near SUTD)

### $800-1,000 Budget
**Best Value Areas:**
1. Clementi (near NUS)
2. Buona Vista (NUS area)
3. Bedok (east region)

### $1,000-1,500 Budget
**Best Value Areas:**
1. Dover/Kent Ridge condos (NUS)
2. Commonwealth
3. Novena/Toa Payoh

### $1,500+ Budget
**Best Options:**
1. City area condos
2. Premium condos near campus
3. Master rooms in best locations
